statements: SELECT * FROM genetic_sequences
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences WHERE id = 1
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences ORDER BY id DESC
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences WHERE id > 5
SELECT * FROM genetic_sequences WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT * FROM genetic_sequences WHERE id BETWEEN 3 AND 6;
SELECT DISTINCT sequence FROM genetic_sequences WHERE id > 2;
SELECT * FROM genetic_sequences WHERE sequence LIKE '%ACGT%';
SELECT * FROM genes;
SELECT gene_name, sequence FROM genes;
SELECT gene_name, sequence FROM genes WHERE id = 3;
SELECT gene_name, sequence, id FROM genes ORDER BY gene_name DESC;
SELECT gene_name, mutation_type FROM genes JOIN mutations ON genes.id = mutations.gene_id;
SELECT * FROM genes WHERE id = 1;
SELECT gene_name, sequence FROM genes WHERE gene_name LIKE '%A%' ORDER BY gene_name DESC;
SELECT genes.gene_name, mutations.mutation_type FROM genes JOIN mutations ON genes.id = mutations.gene_id WHERE mutations.mutation_type = 'Insertion' ORDER BY genes.id ASC;
SELECT genes.id, genes.gene_name, mutations.mutation_description FROM genes LEFT JOIN mutations ON genes.id = mutations.gene_id WHERE mutations.id IS NULL;
SELECT gene_name, COUNT(mutation_type) AS mutation_count FROM genes LEFT JOIN mutations ON genes.id = mutations.gene_id GROUP BY gene_name HAVING mutation_count > 2 ORDER BY mutation_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM genetic_sequences;
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT name, description FROM sequence_metadata WHERE name = 'Example';
SELECT sequence_id, analysis_result FROM sequence_analysis WHERE sequence_id = 1;
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences LIMIT 3 OFFSET 2;
SELECT * FROM genetic_sequences;
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, description FROM sequence_metadata ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT sequence_id, jsonb_array_elements_text(analysis_result->'results') FROM sequence_analysis;
SELECT sequence, analysis_result->'score' AS result_score FROM genetic_sequences JOIN sequence_analysis ON genetic_sequences.id = sequence_analysis.sequence_id;
SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences;
SELECT annotation, sequence_id FROM sequence_annotations ORDER BY annotation DESC;
SELECT id, query_sequence_id, matched_sequence_id FROM sequence_matches WHERE similarity_score > 0.9;

SELECT id, email FROM users WHERE username LIKE '%example%';

SELECT id, sequence FROM genetic_sequences WHERE id > 5 ORDER BY sequence DESC
SELECT annotation FROM sequence_annotations WHERE sequence_id = 3 AND annotation LIKE '%important%'
SELECT users.username, sequence_annotations.annotation FROM users JOIN sequence_annotations ON users.id = sequence_annotations.sequence_id
SELECT * FROM sequence_matches WHERE similarity_score > 0.8 ORDER BY matched_sequence_id
SELECT * FROM genes;
SELECT gene_name, sequence FROM genes WHERE gene_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM proteins ORDER BY molecular_weight DESC;
SELECT protein_name FROM proteins WHERE protein_id = 2;
SELECT alignment_name, alignment_data FROM alignments WHERE alignment_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM genes WHERE gene_id = 1;
SELECT gene_name, sequence FROM genes WHERE gene_id = 2;
SELECT sequence_data FROM sequences WHERE gene_id = 1 ORDER BY sequence_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM proteins WHERE molecular_weight > 50 ORDER BY protein_name ASC;
SELECT mutation_id, gene_name, effect FROM mutations INNER JOIN genes ON mutations.gene_id = genes.gene_id;
